titlestmt.titleproper: College of Physicians of Philadelphia Office of Continuing Education Programs records 1973-1981
titlestmt.sponsor: This collection-level EAD record is a product of the Philadelphia Area Consortium of Special Collections Libraries (PACSCL) Consortial Survey Initiative, which was funded by the Andrew W. Mellon Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: Machine-readable finding aid generated in EAD from data in the PACSCL Consortial Survey Database on 12/21/2012

did.unittitle: College of Physicians of Philadelphia Office of Continuing Education Programs records

bioghist.p: The College of Physicians of Philadelphia, founded in 1787, is the oldest professional medical organization in the country. The College is home to the MÃ¼tter Museum and the Historical Medical Library. Through its program of lectures, workshops, and conferences, as well as through the C. Everett Koop Community Education Center and PhillyHealthInfo.org, an online health information resource, the College provides a place for both medical professionals and the general public to learn about medicine as both a science and as an art.

scopecontent.p: This is a collection of materials from the Office of Continuing Education Programs of the College of Physicians of Philadelphia. The collection includes files from Frank L. Bowler, Dagny Henderson, and J.P. Hubbard. Records related to Practice-related Educational Programs (PREP), the FOCUS program, the Emergency Medical program, and Continuing Medical Education programs. These records include meeting minutes and agendas, reports, newsletters, financial records, grant applications, participant files, program evaluations, correspondence, and printed materials.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.

otherfindaid.p: An inventory is available in the repository.
